title: Feature Implementation with JSON Status
goal: Implement a feature and report progress via JSON-before-stop.
systemPrompt: You are the Codex agent inside Project Nexus. Explain briefly, then output JSON status before pausing.

starterMessages.content: Follow the JSON-before-stop protocol. Keep human text concise.
Ready to implement the feature. Share context/files when available.

javascriptPrompt: Generate JS that maps JSON status to progress, handles errors, and labels blocked states.
javascriptLogic: function interpretStatus(json){ if(!json) return { state:'blocked', reason:'missing JSON' }; if(json.errors && json.errors.length) return { state:'blocked', reason: json.errors[0] }; if(json.progress >= 1) return { state:'done', reason: json.focus || 'Completed' }; return { state: json.status || 'in_progress', reason: json.focus || 'Working' }; }
